name: Silla Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The could easily have been a bad review...we checked into a room on the first floor (#6) and although we were a little disappointed with the look of the room (it was a little hostel-y) we decided to make the best of it. The next morning we were woken quite early because of the proximity to the bar/breakfast area. The floors are marble terrazzo in hallway and the even the slightest sound was magnified. Over breakfast we decided to check with the front desk about changing rooms. They could not have been more accommodating and immediately switched us a lovely room on the third floor. We wished were were staying longer! They didn't even charge us for the upgrade! They new room had a beautiful view, a huge bed, big bathroom (with a separate shower) and it was quiet.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel is a very short walk to anything you want to see in Florence. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat (just not on the main floor!)
reviews.title: Not so good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, we travel 2 times everyyear to visit mensfair in Florence.
reviews.title: Thumbs up,

likes.disliked: — Thin walls with loud guests next door

reviews.text: i have been in florence 25 times, styed in dfifferent hotels,
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel felt very old and little dirty the furniture in the room uhhh veryvery old! not satisfayed at all, brekfast and stuff was ok.
reviews.title: charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a wonderful location that allows easy access to the florence attractions. It is located within sight of the Arno river, and easy walking distance to the ponte vecchio bridge. The only difficulty we had was finding it when traveling from the Siena area. Parking on the street is also difficult to find once you reach the hotel, so we would recommend the extra cost of using their parking garage. The room was large, but very spartan in appearance. However, it was very clean and comfortable. As prices go, it was very reasonable compared to what one could pay in that area. Breakfast at the hotel was very nice, and many restaurants are within walking distance to satisfy anyone's needs. The staff did their best to make sure your needs taken care of, and your questions were answered.
reviews.title: Quaint Hotel, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The employees of Hotel Silla were very helpful while I was making plans via emial. Once at the hotel, the staff was friendly and very knowledgable, the rooms clean and quiet. I did hear from a guest that her room on the first floor was noisey due to guests coming and going so I would suggest a higher floor. My husband and I were on the 3rd floor and all was quiet. A nice continental breakast was offered every morning. A nice way to relax after a full day of sighseeing was to purchase a bottle of wine and some cheese and crackers and go out onto the patio of the hotel and look out over the Arno River.
reviews.title: Great Visit

likes.disliked: — Need to change up the breakfast menu now and then.

reviews.text: On the south side of the Arno, away from the busy traffic, an excellent hotel. Staff very helpful and spoke good english. Our room at the front had a view of the Duomo just across the river. There is a bar in the street below which was noisy one night but generally excellent. Also nearby restaurants good and inexpensive.
reviews.title: Great autumn break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only 10 mins walk to the sights and a good bus service nearby.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

likes.disliked: — They charge one night's accommodation fee for cancellation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom adequate and very comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Great location across Arno River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Silla for 3 nights in a 4th floor room at the front of the hotel overlooking the trees/river/breakfast terrace.
reviews.title: Ideal place...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and efficeint.
reviews.title: A pleasant oasis in Florance
Great staff, calm place
reviews.text: Room was a decent size, quaintly decorated. It was quiet, we noticed very little noise from outside.
Bathroom (shower no bath) was perfectly adequate.
reviews.title: Great Location, Hard Beds

reviews.text: Brerakfast (tea/coffee/hot choc., pastries, meats, cheeses, eggs, rolls, etc) was good, lovely to sit on the terrace.
reviews.title: My stay at the Silla Hotel

likes.disliked: — The shower could have been a teeny bit bigger

reviews.title: Delightful
reviews.text: A very comfortable and well placed hotel near the river in the heart of Flrence within easy walking distance of all the places we wished to see.

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Florence!
reviews.text: After a disappointing stop In Le Marche we headed back to Florence. We had no reservations(Easter weekend) and were able to get a triple room at a great price! SERVICE WAS FABULOUS! We drove into Florence so they went to the street to flag us down and show us parking. They have their own parking! Highly unusual in Florence. It's an old building with charm. If you want modern ammenities this place is not for you. If you want good service and the Italian experience then book it! Breakfast was one of the best in Italy!

reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff
reviews.text: Nice spread with made to order coffee drinks. :) It was too cold to be served on the outside balcony but it sure looked nice! The inside dining room was glamorous with a beautiful chandelier! Oh and our room had a view of the courtyard too which was so peaceful.

reviews.title: very friendly and helpful
reviews.text: We walked to everything! It's a tad bit away from the center of it all but we found that to be a plus. Restaurant recommendations were A+ !!

reviews.title: Gem
reviews.text: Helpful staff, accomodating, lovely balcony, decent room (TV is small but who cares), good location, appropriate value. The service of the front staff sets it apart.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our recent visit to Tuscany we had the pleasure to stay at the Hotel Silla while in Florence. This was a very enjoyable way to begin our holiday. The owner and staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke English very well. The rooms, recently updated, werelarge and well furnished.
reviews.title: Peace in the city

reviews.text: Our breakfast, on the patio, was a treat. Flowers and trees surround this second floor retreat. We returned in the afternoon for a drink and a moment to put our feet up after a day of wandering and sightseeing.
reviews.title: Consistently all around excellence

reviews.text: The Hotel is located on the other side of the Arno. THis makes for a quiet location within walking distance to the Ponte de Verde, Boboli Gardens, Piti Palace and the Uffici.
reviews.title: Great stay, but jaded rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed at this hotel about 5 yrs ago. Discovered through Karen Brown's small hotel book. I was very pleased that 5 yrs later, the ambiance, quality of the room, staff professionalism and friendly was the same! Perfect location away from busy downtown Florence, small market for snacks in the room, cool artsy neighborhood, lovely terrace for evening apperitif and close to the steps up to the Church of Miniato. I would return again.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Hotel Silla to be a wonderful respite from our tour of Florence. Housed above a 15th century palazzo, the hotel has been refurbished and the rooms are clean and fresh. The entire staff were friendly and accomodating and bent over backwards to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. The hotel is a mid-range hotel, not a luxury hotel, yet definitely a delightful taste of Italy. It is located just a block south of the Arno river and is an easy walk to the Ponte Vecchio, the Uffuzi and Duomo. We also enjoyed walking through the neighborhoods south of the hotel and getting a sense of what the non-tourist section of Florence is really like.
reviews.title: Delightful taste of Italy

likes.liked: — The staff and the building itself.

reviews.text: We had breakfast outdoors every morning on the veranda. It was simple but delicious with homemade breads and cereals and of course, expresso. The staff up front helped us book reservations at the Uffizi and the Academy so we could avoid the long lines. They also helped us at our departure figure out how to get our rental car and drive outside the city (on our way to other parts of Tuscany).
reviews.title: yuck
A hidden gem
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely, clean, well kept and will be our destination on our next trip to Florence. It is also well priced for a night's stay and breakfast. We were extremely pleased.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Silla
reviews.text: This location is not terribly convenient, plus it is overlooking the main highway that runs along the arno - very noisy and no air conditioning, so it was roast or listen to the traffic late into the night. This area is also frequented by drug dealers and prostitutes at night. The room was terribly depressing, with fake wood furniture and inadequate lighting. I have stayed at other much nicer places in Florence and don't understand all the positive reviews.

reviews.title: Excellent, friendly service
reviews.text: Great staff, great location, gorgeous old building with private parking. The breakfast is better than average, and the back patio is beautiful. Loved being on the other side of the Arno, much more quiet, but close enough to see Florence on foot. We loved Florence!

reviews.title: Hotel Silla shabby and way out of the way
reviews.text: I had booked this hotel and noticed that they said they would charge the first night. When I arrived it was a two elevator ride to my room. It was a very long walk to a not very nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also noticed that I would have to walk two blocks then cross a bridge every morning to get to the edge of the main part of Florence. We told them that we could not walk this far and that the room was inconvenient, especially for my husband who had walking problems. They said we should have called them sooner. We called an hour after we left and it was before check in time. They charged us $200 for the room. I would not recommend this hotel, mostly because what I saw of it wasn't very nice. They rooms are very worn.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel Silla

likes.liked: — The staff, the view, the terrace cafe
likes.disliked: — Nothing! (Well, the hairdryer provided by the hotel was a bit weak and feeble, but that was a minor thing.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on reviews in TripAdvisor, we booked this hotel for six nights for a holiday in April 2008. We were certainly very happy with our experience there.
reviews.title: The lovely Silla
Great Hotel
reviews.text: As many other reviews have said, the staff at the Hotel Silla are brilliant. Every one of them are friendly and helpful. We booked our stay about six weeks in advance, and asked for a quiet double room on the top floor, with a view, if possible. We were given a large room -- spotlessly clean -- overlooking the park to the front of the hotel. Our room had views of Santa Croce and the Duomo. And although the hotel was full for several of the nights we were there, we never really heard any of the other guests from our room.
The staff also offered to make advance bookings for us at the various museums in the city. We took advantage of this, and made reservations for the Bargello and the Accademia.
reviews.title: Pleasant, quiet stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had just arrived from the US and were exhausted. The staff was more than friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable, and even upgraded our room at no cost. We had a lovely view of the garden square out front and the duomo in the distance. Every time we passed the front desk, they would inquire if we needed anything... they were wonderful. Breakfast was the best of our entire stay in Florence, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice quiet charming room with European flair, comfort and convenience.
reviews.title: This hotel is a little gem!

reviews.text: We chose the Silla Hotel from a guide book because it was a small hotel and on the quieter side of the River Arno and the building itself sounded interesting. The staff were friendly and helpful to any questions we asked. Even though we didn't have one of the most expensive rooms, we had a lovely view over the balcony with flowers, trees and partially of the river. Everything was clean with extra amenities such as the safe included in the cost.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: The location was perfect, it was easy walking distance to all the cities main attractions and behind the hotel we walked to some beautiful Tuscan views. There is an excellent pizzeria on the same road too!
reviews.title: A Tuscany Treat

likes.liked: — The personal attention from the staff and the location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVED it here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! We selected Hotel Silla due to the reviews of others and the location. We certainly made the correct choice. Our stay of three nights was delightful. The staff went out of their way to help us in SO many ways. We inquired about finding a flea market with old rusty leftover things. The next day we had a note with a map of where to go and it was a treasure trove of exactly the kind of things we were looking for. When the train strike hit on our travel day, the staff could not have been more helpful. We loved our breakfasts in the morning on the balcony overlooking the Arno. We booked two walking tours through the hotel before we arrived. They were excellent--one with four of us and the other with eight of us which made for a very intimate and calm experience. I can only hope that I will get to visit Hotel Silla again!
reviews.title: Nice hotel in artists' section

likes.liked: — Quiet but convenient location; helpful staff

reviews.text: I go to Florence at least twice a year and like 3-star hotels: not too ritzy, not too rough. I have stayed in several fine hotels, a few too far out, and most with easy access to the center of town. The Silla was a special treat because it was quite close in, yet quiet, not terribly expensive and not as tiny as many similarly-priced hotels I have stayed in (Pitti Palace Ponte Vecchiio springs to mind . . . another favorite, but nowhere near as pretty! And without wifi.)
reviews.title: very nice, very special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside breakfast patio was in full bloom with a wall of incredible jasmine, potted roses, lavendar, bougainvilla, begonias, and marigolds (I do not know where the "lime-scented" came from in the publicity, but who cares. The patio is one floor above the street, overlooking a little park and the Arno. What a pleasure. The wifi was free and offered excellent reception. The staff was a little better than the typical Florentines in my experience, wiling to help with information, and the front desk even made a few telephone calls for me to get information when I found myself in town on a holiday weekend (which means not everything was always open). If this hotel is available and within the price range when i return in the fall, I will book here in a flash.
reviews.title: Very pleased with Hotel Silla

reviews.text: Excellent hotel with friendly and helpful service. The double room was large with plenty of space for luggage and clothes. The location was good - within walking distance of the main Florence sights, but located in a quiet neighborhood across the river away from the huge crowds.
reviews.title: Great staff, great location & beautiful terrace

reviews.text: Available parking garage was another real bonus as we had a rental car having driven from Rome and spent a week in the hilltowns before going to Florence.
reviews.title: Lucky discovery

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Silla. The staff was extremely friendly & helpful. Antonio at front reception got me dinner reservations one night at Mamma Gina's, when I couldn't get one myself. The staff recommended good places to go & always had smiles on their faces. The reception staff were all helpful and offered suggestions when asked without hesitation . They gave advice on best times to do stuff or ways to get somewhere easily. When not busy, especially the night reception, enjoyed chatting with guests.
reviews.title: Great Hotel away from the crowds
An excellent quiet hotel
reviews.text: Very good comfortable hotel. Rooms facing the Arno were quiet and had a good view. Friends said the other side was noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had all the essentials and the beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
Absoletly loved Silla
reviews.text: The staff at the desk were extremely polite and helpful. Breakfast was simole but good.

reviews.title: Second Visit
reviews.text: The situation, away from the tourist crowds but accessible to the centre was excellent. We would happily go there again.

reviews.title: Noisy place!
reviews.text: Alexander and Mary Stirling

My friend and I stayed at hotel Silla in July and really felt that it was a great value for Florence. We got an online rate of 90 euros for a double room. We liked the Otrarno area, great restaurants and not too far to walk to popular tourist sites. The rooms were clean and had the hotel staff were very helpful and nice. The best part of the hotel is their breakfast and breakfast patio. The only negative in my opinion was that the beds weren't that comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful. The setting is lovely. While there were 2 small very busy bars with outside seating on the same street that looked great for young adults, there was no noise in the room at all.
reviews.title: Nice place but the bed is too hard!

reviews.text: The view from the room of the Arno was great.
reviews.title: Our expectations were exceeded

likes.liked: — Old Italian palazzo style and terrace, and location
likes.disliked: — Internal lift from first floor to the uppoer floors is a bit small (but main door lift spacious).

reviews.text: The breakfast is more than adequate and the staff is friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A view From Above

likes.disliked: — lots of stairs but there was an elevator

reviews.text: Our main complaint was the bed. It was so firm that we both had backaches for the entire trip. The bathroom was also extremely tight, but okay.
reviews.title: Florence hotel with outside breakfast patio

reviews.text: Hotel Silla was a great hotel. The location was incredible, with a beautiful view of the park and the river in the background. The rooms were well appointed, and very clean. The front desk staff and the breakfast staff were just so wonderful, had great recommendations and were eager to help us in any way. The location was perfect as it was across the bridge from the city. It was a quick walk to all of the sights in Florence, and a calm, quiet respite at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Price, Great Location

reviews.text: Our family was delighted with everything about this fine, moderately priced hotel. The staff was very polite and accomodating, the rooms were clean, and the breakfasts were very nice. In addition, the hotel is so conveniently located that we could walk to most of the places we were especially interested in. We would certainly stay there again on another visit to Florence.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price, and great staff

reviews.text: This was our third stay at Hotel Silla. They have a wonderful location, all the taxis know where they are located. On the far side of the river, but an easy walk across the nearby bridges. Very clean & bright. Lovely, full American breakfast included. The staff has always been tremendous. We had a medical issue come up & the night staff found us an English speaking doctor that could see one of our group immediately. Wonderful service & can't say enough good things! Anytime in Florence, we will stay here!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL, CLEAN, BRIGHT & WONDERFUL WALKING LOCATION AWAY FROM THE TOURISTS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Silla was terrific. Our room was spacious and nicely furnished. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with museum reservations and restaurant recommendations. The breakfast was excellent. There is a very nice rooftop terrace where drinks are served in the late afternoon and evening. The location across the Arno (Oltrarno) from the historic downtown offers welcome relief from the crowds while still being very convenient (10 minute walk to the Duomo).
reviews.title: Hotel Silla was terrific.

likes.disliked: — Coolness of room was only average on warm days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in mid-October. We had an upper room that looked out over the back street and was very quiet. The room was very large comfortable and very clean. The location is perfect - far enough from downtown to not be in the "thick of things" but within walking distance of everything. The staff were particularly helpful especially with local dinner suggestions around Santa Crocce. Each evening we enjoyed a drink on the hotel terrace with guests from all over the world. Would highly recommend the Silla Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for price and location

likes.disliked: — Nothing really to dislike for the price

reviews.text: Hotel Silla is wonderfully located in the Oltrarno area of Florence - across the river - about a 5 minute walk from the Ponte Vecchio; and crossing the river about 20 minutes from the Duomo, at a very leisurely pace.
reviews.title: Great Service at Hotel Silla!

likes.disliked: — The decor was a little dated and of average quality, but fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. I was in contact with them for many weeks prior to arriving, and they helped to arrange a private driver to the wine country, as well as a group tour at the last minute when our plans changed. They provided restaurant recommendations and reservations for some museums that required them. I believe all of the desk staff spoke English.
reviews.title: wonderful place to stay

likes.liked: — location, quietness, the terrace, the breakfasts
likes.disliked: — a little larger room and air conditioning

reviews.text: The included breakfast was more than adequate - it is the same each day, but offers fresh fruit and juices, as well as eggs, toast and pastries, meat and cheese, yoghurt and cereal. The pleasant server takes your order for coffee, cappucino, cioccolata (hot chococate) or tea.
reviews.title: Friendly Clean Hotel - Great Locatoin

likes.disliked: — Small hard beds - typical of Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a nice hotel located at walking distance of main attactions but in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood. In the last years Florence has become very hectic with what seems thousands of motor bikes crisscrossing in all directions. We had hoped to be out of those noises and pollution.
reviews.title: Old fashion charm in a peaceful location close to all attractions.

reviews.text: Hotel Silla, on the left bank of the River Arno opposite Santa Croce,
reviews.title: Very Very Nice Accomodations at Hotel Silla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the famous XIII Century square and church where Michelangelo and Dante are buried was ideal for us. The hotel is located on the upper floors of a charming XV palazzo. The elevator opens to a beautiful Rennaissance courtyard.
reviews.title: Hotel Silla is the perfect place to stay, when visiting Florence.

likes.disliked: — There was nothing that we would change.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room faced a small tree lined square, the Arno flowing behind it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.disliked: — There was nothing negative about this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked everywhere, except when we arrived to the train station. We
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Florence

reviews.text: The Hotel Silla is a well-situated, clean and comfortable respite from the busy streets of Florence.The hotel is quiet, though located within walking distance of the main sights of Florence. The staff at the Silla are exceptionally friendly and helpful and really made us feel like honoured guests. The rooms are small, but not crowded and with all the things to see in Florence you don't spend much time in your hotel room. The bathroom is spacious, with an enclosed shower (so the whole room doesn't get soaked!) and shelves for your toiletries, which many hotels seem to overlook. The roof top terrace is a lovely place for breakfast or writing postcards with a glass of chianti at hand. The breakfast buffet had all the things we like: yogurt, fresh fruit, local pastries plus hot items for those who prefer eggs, toast, etc. I would definitely stay at the Silla again.
reviews.title: A Tuscan treat!

reviews.text: The interior is in need of an update, but this is part of it's charm. The location is on the "other" side of the Arno, and perfect for some of the quieter sites (Boboli gardens, Piazzale Michelangelo) while the "main" tourist attractions are just a walk across the bridge. Our room faced the river and was clean and comfortable, although a bit loud. If you want the view, you're going to hear the traffic. The staff was perfectly lovely- wonderful, warm, and helpful. Be sure to have dinner at Cingale Bianco (a few blocks away) and get the amazing pear ravioli at the trattoria down the street.
reviews.title: wonderful staff, lovely terrace

reviews.text: Perfect location, great hotel, friendly staff and a lovely breakfast. Couldn't have picked a better hotel. Our room was large, view of the Arno and the beds were comfy. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay (we were there a week). The greatest surprise was that there was a breakfast buffet every morning which set up our day of sightseeing just great.
reviews.title: Brillant Hotel

likes.disliked: — At times you can hear people in the hallway, not the most soundproofed but between the rooms you couldn't really hear anything.

reviews.text: Hotel Silla has a great location on the south edge of the Arno River and within walking distance of Florence's sights. We chose it because of its location and on-site garage. Private cars are not allowed inside the city (across the Arno) except for residents, taxis and such.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Spaciousness of rooms and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Light too dim in room. Bathroom fine.

reviews.text: The price was modest and the staff exceptionally helpful with maps directions, ICE, etc. A very nice breakfast on a terrace overlooking the Arno. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. They have two wireless PC's (gratis) for those that must have a daily dose of the Internet.
reviews.title: Loved Tuskany
Great side of the river
reviews.text: Would we stay there again...you bet.

reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Florence
reviews.text: Paul T. Sarasota, FL

reviews.title: Great Service
reviews.text: I booked Hotel Silla after reading reviews on the Trip Advisor web site and didn’t regret it for a second. Lovely hotel, good location. Wonderful staff, friendly and helpful. My single room was small but clean, quiet and I didn’t spend a lot of time in it.
this was our second time we stayed at this hotel, we stayed for 10 days, the staff was very helpful and the hotel is great.
reviews.title: great service and friendly staff
Great location
reviews.text: The Silla was in a great location for walking to all the sites - Pitti Palace, Boboli Gardens, Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi gallery and other museums, the Duomo and churches, markets, and upscale shopping. We walked all day for the 3 days we were in Florence - not a place to have a car. The hotel was quiet - set back from the street on the other side of a small park that runs along the Arno River. The hotel has an elevator, which is not found at all small hotels, and was a big help since the lobby and hotel rooms start on the second floor. The staff were friendly and helpful - made good recommendations for dining and placed reservations. Breakfast was good especially if you like cappucino and croissants filled with chocolate, vanilla custard, or peach preserves! Fresh fruit, cheese, ham, eggs that you can put in hot water appliance for soft or hard boiling also. When the weather is nice (our last day only) breakfast is on a beautiful terrace filled with flower pots. The rooms were adequate - nothing fancy and frankly need updating - but clean and comfortable - we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The price was good when we compared it to other places we considered - we were very satisfied with our choice.

Hotel Silla was an older hotel in need of a few updates, but still clean. The rooms were absolutely enormous, but the bed and especially the pillows were as hard as bricks. We went and bought a few 5 Euro pillows at the street fair. (aka: bring a pillow from home.) However, the staff was very nice, providing us with a map and even umbrellas when it rained. The breakfast was an extensive buffet, and you could even hard-boil eggs. There was also a beautiful flowered patio for eating breakfast. The hotel is located on the other side of the Arno River from the main attractions, but these could be reached by a very pleasant walk along the river.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel with air-conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Silla three nights in September. Room was small but clean. The breakfast was very nice. Enjoyed relaxing on the beautiful terrace after a day of sight seeing. Leisurely 10 minute walk to the Ponte Vechio. Nice restaurants close to the hotel. Staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Enoyed our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice clean hotel situated in a quiet part of Florence slightly off the center of the city but within easy walking distance from most sites. Very good air conditioning gave a welcome cool rests from a hot Florence during our stay in July. The room was a bit dark but spacey and quiet, and the beds were good.
reviews.title: Nice quiet hotel

likes.liked: — The cool quiet room and the breakfast terrace

reviews.text: I heartily recommend the Silla.
reviews.title: Great Service, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in the very quiant San Niccolo neighbourhood; just accross the Arno and the main centre of Florence, very easy enjoyable walk to all the major sites, but you enjoy the setting of a true Florentinian residential neighbourhood. Great pizza restaurant on the same street as well as two great coffe/bar places next door. Pharmacy and small grocery store also next door.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean, 24 hour front desk service, and the staff are all pleasant, and accomodating.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location

reviews.text: The breakfast offered was great as well... .Fresh fruit, freshly boiled eggs, ham cheese cappuchino you name it.... you could leave with a full stomach that will last you well into lunch time.
reviews.title: Great Value in Florence!

likes.disliked: — Florence might get boring after a few days

reviews.text: But again, the best thing I would say about the hotel is its location. Florence can get pretty crowded especially in August when we went and at the end of the day you get pretty tired and just want a peaceful place to relax and unwind. This hotel is just that. Towards the end of our trip we even thought it worth the time to take a couple of hours off in the afternoon and come back for a shower and siesta.
reviews.title: A Splendid, Good Value Stay Near Santa Croce

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Silla on the recommendation of an acquaintance who lives in Florence. The location is ideal--close to all the attractions, but on the quiet side of the Arno. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the room was generous and very clean. We were in a room on the back of the hotel where there is a small, well-travelled street. This was very noisy on occasion, but we didn't notice it after a day or so.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The dining room is lovely and a typical European buffet is served every morning. The waitstaff was most attentive and pleasant. There is an outside veranda available to all guests overlooking the park and the Arno which was a lovely feature, especially in the late afternoon and evening. Drinks are available here also.
reviews.title: Hotel Silla is the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Silla was not a good choice...it was very noisy...the Hotel is worn, but the breakfast was good. On a map the location looks close to everything, but we have stayed at other Hotel's in Florence with better locations. After 8 trips to Italy, booking Hotel Silla was my worse booking ever...the internet overrates Hotel Silla. The bars with outdoor seating on the street in front of the Hotel were loud and stayed opened late...the street noisy from the cars, scooters, and motorcycles seemed like a race track. The pricing was in line with other Hotels...I just made a mistake in booking this Hotel, I should have done more homework.
reviews.title: Not a Good Choice

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Silla. We found the staff very professional, pleasant, and accomodating. The hotel is located away from the bustle of the tourist areas but within a 5 -10 minute walk to the Uffizi. Pitti Palace, or Santa Croce. The rooms are as advertised -not luxurious, a little spartan, but adequate and comfortable. The terrace is delightful, a perfect place for breakfast or an afternoon drink. The location is quiet except for occasional late night carousers on the weekend, not the hotel's fault but something to be aware of; bring some ear plugs just in case. Wireless internet is available along with a computer in the hotel lobby. The guide books recommend this hotel and we agree.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, good rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked a 4 night stay at Hotel Silla after reading the great reviews here and we are really glad we did! First of all, our room was clean, huge and even had a second "room" with a third bed. We did not book this on purpose, but it would be perfect for someone traveling with a child. The hotel location is great, as Florence is a very walkable city. You won't get overrun by tourists in the neighborhood around Silla, but you will see a lot of young people at the nearby restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly service!

reviews.text: The staff at Hotel Silla absolutely make it stand out as excellent. Massimo was extremely helpful for us, giving us great restaurant suggestions, help with booking tickets to the Uffizi, and also going out of his way to set us a table on the hotel terrace when we arrived with wine and cheese we purchased down the street. I highly recommend Hotel Silla as a great place to stay in Florence!
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: The large breakfast included good cappuccino, fresh bread etc. We ate our breakfasts on the terrace which is close to a small park and the river Arno.
reviews.title: Would Certainly Do it Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel personnel was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent experience at Hotel Silla

reviews.text: We experienced the hotel as very price worthy and if we go back to Florence I'd probably stay in the same hotel.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel
Loved the Hotel Silla
reviews.text: Hotell Silla is a very lovely hotel in a section of the city that is a bit away from the hustle-bustle (we viewd that as positive) and a very manageable walk to all of the sights. We had 2 rooms for our family of 5 (3 boys aged 20, 18, and 15). The rooms were well appointed, spacious, and immaculate (I am extremely fussy when it comes to cleanliness). The staff was most accommodating, ranging from booking reservations via email in advance to the museums, to helping us with some telephone communication problems concerning the next leg of our trip. Mrs. Silla was takes great pride in her property. If we ever have the opportunity to vist Florence again, Hotel Silla is where we would stay.

We just returned from 3 nights in Florence at the Hotel Silla and were very pleased with our choice. We knew going into it that the room would be basic and small - we had intentionally chosen the "small room" knowing we would not be in our room much. The shower and toilet were both within the same shower curtain but again, we expected small quarters since we had reserved the small room.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.liked: — Excellent value, Nice walk along river to our destination each day
likes.disliked: — Extremely close quarters in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property was very clean and the front desk staff were helpful in response to all of our questions. They recognized and greeted us each time we came or left which we thought was a nice personal touch. They were very amenable when we requested large bottles of water one night after coming home and made our airport transfer reservations for us.
reviews.title: Exellent value

likes.disliked: — A couple of trendy and loud on the weekend winebars down the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a singles nightclub right down the street called Zoe which we visited one night and was full of locals. This was a plus for us and we were never disturbed by the noise at night.
reviews.title: The Wonderful Hotel Silla

description: Enjoy your moments of rest in Florence in a XV century palace, away from the tourist crowds but at only 5 minutes walking distance from Ponte Vecchio, Uffizzi Gallery and the Cathedral. Have your buffet breakfast in our lovely terrace or just relax with a refreshing drink after a day among art, history and shopping. Hotel Silla offers a gracious hospitality. Each of our well-furnished rooms has air-conditioning, satellite TV, mini-bar, direct-dial telephone and safe. The hotel is provided with a spacious garage, located in the same hotel building.
